name.japanese: ロングリングロングランド

description: A unique archipelago consisting of ten islands arranged in a ring shape, connected by land bridges that surface once per year. Everything on the island - animals, plants, and terrain - is unusually elongated in height or length due to the vast plains allowing unrestricted growth.

keyEvents.title: Tonjit and Shelly's Reunion
keyEvents.description: Tonjit joyfully reunites with his horse Shelly on the plains of Long Ring Long Land after ten years of separation.
keyEvents.significance: A heartwarming moment that sets up the emotional context for Foxy's cruel attack.

keyEvents.title: Foxy Pirates Arrive
keyEvents.description: The Foxy Pirates make their dramatic entrance to Long Ring Long Land, confronting the Straw Hats.
keyEvents.significance: The arrival of the arc's antagonists and the setup for the Davy Back Fight competition.

keyEvents.title: Davy Back Fight Challenge Issued
keyEvents.description: Foxy challenges Luffy to a Davy Back Fight on Long Ring Long Land, initiating the competition that will dominate the arc.
keyEvents.significance: Long Ring Long Land serves as the venue for the Davy Back Fight games, a major world-building event.

statusHistory.reason: Island continues to exist as a unique geographic location in Paradise

uniqueFeatures: Ten islands connected in a ring formation
Land bridges surface once per year during low tide
All flora and fauna are extremely elongated
Inhabited by nomadic peoples resembling Mongolic cultures

culturalSignificance: Long Ring Long Land is notable for being the setting where the Davy Back Fight tradition is introduced to the story. The annual tidal changes that reveal the land bridges create the massive water displacement responsible for Water 7's Aqua Laguna phenomenon.
trivia: The inhabitants live in yurt-style dwellings and follow nomadic lifestyles
An Eternal Pose cannot navigate between the individual islands since they form one connected landmass
The Log Pose sets to the next island in less than one day
Following the destruction of Lulusia Kingdom, one of Long Ring Long Land's islands became partially flooded due to rising sea levels
